Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
dinky \dinky\ adj. 1. small and insignificant; shabby or unimpressive; as, he drove to work in a dinky old Volkswagen; we stayed in a dinky little hotel. [informal] [WordNet 1.5]
2. pretty and neat; fashionable or well-dressed; as, what a dinky little hat. [British informal] [WordNet 1.5]

dinky adj 1: small and insignificant; "we stayed in a dinky old hotel" 2: (British informal) pretty and neat; "what a dinky little hat" n : a small locomotive [syn: {dinkey}] [also: {dinkiest}, {dinkier}]
